author: techbro_ccoli
content:
We have a test for this here: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/blob/main/tests/cancun/eip4844_blobs/test_blob_txs.py#L767-L787
But it is skipped during the filling process as the `t8n` tool see the `tx.to=None`  as invalid.
We used a workaround for earlier test releases and all clients were passing this case. Although now that you have brought it up we should definitely have it filling in the latest release!

I can generate this for you just now if it helps re.debugging?

author: s1na
content: By now I realized that I do in fact need to check for `tx.to == nil` when user passes in blob hashes to `eth_call` via RPC. Because the way geth handles this case is it cannot deserialize a TX that is missing an address (the same thing you're describing for `t8n`). And for eth_call we use a different serialization so the check needed to be added there too.
